column2:
verb
  1. to be born; to give birth
  2. to supply; to provide
  3. to have; to possess

pron
  1. I (personal pronoun)
  2. me (direct object of a verb)
  3. me (object of a preposition)
  4. me (indirect object of a verb)
  5. my (belonging to me)

noun
  1. child (a female or male child, a daughter or son)
  2. (Christianity) Son, one of the three persons of the Trinity, believed to have become incarnated in Jesus Christ

verb
  1. to lift (to raise sth)
  2. to stand up
  3. to raise up
  4. to wake up
  5. to leave (to go away from a place)

noun
  1. goose (a grazing waterfowl of the family Anatidae)

noun
  1. devil, demon (wicked spirit)
  2. ghost, familiar spirit (especially of ancestor, in whatever guise it appears)
  3. the dead

noun
  1. smoke (visible particles and vapour given off by burning material)

noun
  1. (anatomy) liver (organ of the body)
  2. heart (emotions or kindness)

verb
  1. to be present, to exist, be there
  2. to have, to possess

noun
  1. moon (largest natural satellite of planet Earth)
  2. moon (any substantially sized natural satellite of a planet)
  3. month (period into which a year is divided)

verb
  1. to stay; to reside; to live in

verb
  1. (intransitive) to hear (to perceive with the ear)
  2. (transitive) to hear (to perceive with the ear)
  3. (intransitive) to listen (to pay attention to a sound)
  4. (intransitive) to listen (to wait for a sound)
  5. (intransitive) to listen (to accept oral instruction)

verb
  1. to sit (to be in a position in which the upper body is upright and the legs are supported)

noun
  1. dew (moisture in the air that settles on plants, etc)

conj
  1. and (used to connect two similar words, phrases, et cetera)

prep
  1. with

noun
  1. sugar (sucrose from sugar cane or sugar beet and used to sweeten food and drink)

noun
  1. mother (female (human) who parents a child, gives birth to a baby, or is pregnant)

verb
  1. to watch over
  2. to take care of
  3. to celebrate

noun
  1. A type of Iban poem of themes like love or heroism

adv
  1. Semelfactive or non-iterative aspect i. e. the action or situation has happened once or more but did not repeat itself

noun
  1. village
  2. community (an area where a particular ethnic group inhabits)

noun
  1. (anatomy) head (part of the body)
  2. (figuratively) leader, chief, head

adj
  1. left (the west side of the body when one is facing north)

noun
  1. bite-sized cakes, cookies or pastry, especially the steamed ones made in Southeast Asia or Southern China

noun
  1. skin (outer covering of the body of a person)
  2. leather (material produced by tanning animal skin)
  3. shell (covering of a nut)

adj
  1. long (duration of time)
  2. old (inanimate object)
  3. old (something from the distant past)

verb
  1. to miss, to yearn for, to long for

adj
  1. free from oppression (e.g. slavery)
  2. (politics) free from colonialism, annexation, military occupation, etc.; liberated; independent
  3. (rare) free from an obligation, especially a prison sentence
  4. (rare) self-sufficient; independent; not dependent on others

adv
  1. (interrogative) For what cause, reason, or purpose.

noun
  1. (geography) confluence (point where two rivers or streams meet)

noun
  1. jackfruit, fruit of the tropical tree Artocarpus heterophyllus

noun
  1. field; meadow
  2. large space covered with one kind of vegetation
  3. freshwater swamp, usually flooded and supporting few plants

noun
  1. tomorrow (The day after the present day.)

adv
  1. tomorrow (On the day after the present day.)

verb
  1. to roast; to bake
  2. to cure by smoking

noun
  1. sweat (bodily fluid ejected through the skin to cool down the body)

noun
  1. house (abode)
  2. home (house or structure in which someone lives)

noun
  1. love; compassion; affection
  2. longing; yearning

verb
  1. to love
  2. to long for; to yearn for

adj
  1. with the sound which flow through nose while speaking

adj
  1. resistant (not easily damaged)
  2. perseverant
  3. undamaged
  4. invincible
  5. detained

verb
  1. to arrest; to detain
  2. to hold on someone
  3. to stop something/someone

noun
  1. tin
  2. can (an airtight container, made of tin or another metal, used to preserve food.)

verb
  1. (intransitive) to change (to become something different)
  2. (transitive) to change (to make something into something different)

adj
  1. endmost (last in a series, furthest away)

noun
  1. tip (extreme top of something)

verb
  1. to measure (ascertain the quantity of a unit)

prep
  1. by
  2. because of

verb
  1. can (to be able to)
  2. may (to have permission to)
